oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Specialisation through co-operation between farms in organic farming
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Lätti, M.
Koikkalainen, K.
Kuisma, M.
Lötjönen, T.
Nykänen, A.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Farm economics
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Co-operation in organic production provides the potential for production specialisation with the help of co-operation in machinery use, input integration, crop rotation, shared buildings and marketing. Co-operation models provide the opportunity to optimise production between different lines of production from environmental, economic and functional perspectives.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Lätti, M.; Koikkalainen, K.; Kuisma, M.; Lötjönen, T. and Nykänen, A. (2005) Specialisation through co-operation between farms in organic farming. In: NJF Report, Nordic Association of Agricultural Scientists, 1 (1), p. 266.
